Title.evidence: This review aimed to comprehensively describe the current pre-clinical and clinical evidence for RIC in orthopaedics.

Participants.evidence: Sixteen clinical RCTs, involving 628 patients, investigated RIC in 6 different elective orthopaedic procedures (knee, lower limb, cervical, shoulder, general, hip fracture).

Intervention.evidence: RIC protocols varied in cycle frequency, duration, and pressure, but all were given as a single dose at induction of anaesthesia.

Objective.evidence: This review aimed to comprehensively describe the current pre-clinical and clinical evidence for RIC in orthopaedics.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixteen clinical RCTs, involving 628 patients, investigated RIC in 6 different elective orthopaedic procedures

Result_Outcome.evidence: Significant results included reductions in oxidative stress, improved cerebral and peripheral oxygenation, and reduced pain scores and analgesia use.
